Title:
Trechispora daweishanensis and T. xantha spp. nov. found in
Yunnan Province of China
Keywords:
Basidiomycetes, phylogeny, taxonomy, Trechisporales,
wood-inhabiting fungi
Abstract:
Two wood-inhabiting fungal species, Trechispora
daweishanensis and T. xantha spp. nov. are proposed based on a
combination of morphological features and molecular evidence.
Trechispora daweishanensis is characterized by an annual growth habit of
basidiomata with tuberculate hymenophore, a monomitic hyphal system with
clamped generative hyphae and ellipsoid, hyaline, thin-walled, smooth
basidiospores measuring 3.85 × 2.73.5 µm. Trechispora xantha is
characterized by resupinate, cracked basidiomata with buff hymenial
surface, a monomitic hyphal system and ellipsoid, hyaline, thin-walled,
smooth basidiospores. Sequences of ITS and nLSU gene regions of the
studied samples were generated. The phylogenetic analysis based on
molecular data of ITS+nLSU sequences supported the novelty of these two
species.
